Content:: The World Charter for Nature was adopted by United Nations member nation-states on October 28, 1982. It proclaims five "principles of conservation by which all human conduct affecting nature is to be guided and judged." The vote was 111 for, one against (United States), 18 abstentions.[2]  This article related to international law is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
Title: World Charter for Nature - Wikipedia
